abstract.p: Claire G Miller letter on Bill Gale's May 12 travel article agrees that London has changed (S)

block.p: To the Editor: Bill Gale paints a warm and fuzzy picture of London in ''Fie on 'Cool Britannia'!'' (May 12), which is indeed more the London of his and my memory than the one our family encountered several weeks ago.

At Oxford not only the students but the dons as well have shed the robes in which they used to skitter through the streets. On Jermyn Street, where our small hotel and many of the most famous names in men's haberdashery are all situated, the only man wearing a tailored jacket and tie was my husband.

To the Editor: Bill Gale paints a warm and fuzzy picture of London in ''Fie on 'Cool Britannia'!'' (May 12), which is indeed more the London of his and my memory than the one our family encountered several weeks ago.

At Oxford not only the students but the dons as well have shed the robes in which they used to skitter through the streets. On Jermyn Street, where our small hotel and many of the most famous names in men's haberdashery are all situated, the only man wearing a tailored jacket and tie was my husband.
I think that tea at the Four Seasons Hotel in New York is a dressier affair than at Brown's. I doubt a return to the city of ''gentle eccentricities.''
CLAIRE G. MILLER New York, N.Y.
